content: On a year-over-year basis, loans increased by 5.6 billion, or about 8.5% primarily due to increases in the branch network, which grew by 3.5 billion and mortgage channel grew by 1.6 million; and in the commercial bank, industry verticals grew by 1 billion led by strong growth in healthcare and TMT, business capital was up 632 billion over '21 and all of these increases were offset by $742 million decline in real estate finance loans.
